etomica.atom

Class MoleculesetArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.atom.MoleculesetArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMoleculeList, java.io.Serializable

    public class MoleculesetArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMoleculeList, java.io.Serializable
    AtomSet formed by wrapping an Atom array. Size of array cannot be changed after construction.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoleculesetArray(IMolecule[] atoms)
      Wraps the given atom array.
      MoleculesetArray(IMoleculeList atomSet)
      Makes a new instance holding the atoms in the given atom set.
      MoleculesetArray(int nAtoms)
      Wraps a new atom array of the given length.
      MoleculesetArray(MoleculesetArray atomSet)
      Copy constructor, wrapping a new array unique to this instance but holding the same atoms as the given atom set.

      • MoleculesetArray

        public MoleculesetArray(int nAtoms)
        Wraps a new atom array of the given length.

      • MoleculesetArray

        public MoleculesetArray(IMoleculeList atomSet)
        Makes a new instance holding the atoms in the given atom set. Makes zero-body AtomSet if argument is null.

      • MoleculesetArray

        public MoleculesetArray(MoleculesetArray atomSet)
        Copy constructor, wrapping a new array unique to this instance but holding the same atoms as the given atom set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if argument is null

      • MoleculesetArray

        public MoleculesetArray(IMolecule[] atoms)
        Wraps the given atom array. Subsequent call to getArray will return the array instance given here.

      • getArray

        public IMolecule[] getArray()
        Returns:
        the wrapped array of atoms, which is declared final in the class.

      • setAtoms

        public void setAtoms(IMolecule[] newAtoms)
        Copies the atoms in the given array to the wrapped, final array of atoms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length of array is not equal to count field of this instance.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if argument is null.

      • setAtoms

        public void setAtoms(IMoleculeList atomSet)
        Copies the atoms in the given atom set to the wrapped array of atoms.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length of array is not equal to count field of this instance.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if argument is null

      • getMoleculeCount

        public int getMoleculeCount()
        Returns the length of the wrapped array.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the number of atoms in the set
